data.text: As the World Heritage Committee is examining 35 nominations for inscription, have a look at some of the newest additions to @UNESCO’s World Heritage List: https://t.co/6nAEsOOaSV

#WomensProgress2019 report highlights importance of women's access to resources, not only for themselves, but for the benefit of the entire family. https://t.co/vVzffsF4LN via @UN_Women #FamiliesOfToday https://t.co/TYr6OTJ0Pb

Since 2014, more than 32,000 migrants have died or gone missing, including nearly 1,600 children. More in @UNmigration's new #FatalJourneys Report. https://t.co/mgNEokHV3C #ForMigration https://t.co/mHPYF38lVw

Global temperature rise of 1.5°C = loss of 80 million full-time jobs by 2030.

Young computer programmers & scientists - here's your chance to use your skills to help address the climate crisis. Register here for a chance to join the UN #ClimateAction Summit: https://t.co/HpL0Trvmq8 https://t.co/M7x7wa8mtp

Together we have the power to transform our world.

@AminaJMohammed talks about the importance of partnerships for achieving the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/7AngTB8Qlu https://t.co/Gq0sm5OcE1

This week, @UNESCO launched new #HerEducationOurFuture initiative aimed at opening up opportunities for girls & women by fast-tracking action for education. https://t.co/bO4r2VamJ1 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/0UQjTJI61h

From disability inclusion, to empowering women & girls, to achieving the #GlobalGoals, @UNDP shares how it's working to address the root causes of inequality: https://t.co/BwXsKaY6ab https://t.co/B84tRdZub5

Bangladesh: @WFP is providing emergency food assistance to almost 5,000 Rohingya refugees after heavy rains flooded camps. Engineers are working to keep the camps safe. https://t.co/6sSxEUhSK7 #ZeroHunger https://t.co/tMY3unvwIs

= 10% of the total working population across the 🌎.

“The fate of more than 30 million Venezuelans rests on the leadership's willingness & ability to put the human rights of the people ahead of any personal, ideological or political ambitions” -- @UNHumanRights Chief @mbachelet #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/7h8LhJKb0j

Bayan Abu Kaf from Jordan is a Police Officer #ServingForPeace with @UNPOL with the @UNPeacekeeping mission @unmissmedia, in South Sudan. Read her inspiring story: https://t.co/J0SVh1Gpj0 https://t.co/HiZQz5YytI

"People may think it’s a man’s world, but it’s everybody’s world." 

@ILO is working to promote opportunities in the maritime world for women like Captain Jasmin Labarda. https://t.co/oMWLvbwowk #GlobalGoals

“Everything has changed. We used to understand the weather - not anymore.” 

People in the Republic of Congo share how the climate crisis has impacted their lives. https://t.co/sH9cbeRneB #ClimateAction
Our air, water & food all rely on biodiversity. Here's what @FAO is doing to promote sustainable agriculture to end poverty & hunger. https://t.co/5QGJOoXbS2 #ZeroHunger https://t.co/oCeWYbaARK

48 countries & territories worldwide still maintain some form of HIV-related travel restrictions. 

6 people share stories about how these laws have impacted their lives: https://t.co/TDTTqjd4n5 via @UNAIDS https://t.co/QzRbDgmRFH

Too many girls & women are being held back from accessing quality education. @UNESCO's "Her Education, Our Future" initiative aims to accelerate action toward greater equality in education. https://t.co/EEdfmvPvWz #GlobalGoals https://t.co/IgTMudKzy0

Beyond the security & humanitarian challenges facing Mali, lies a country full of beauty. @UN_MINUSMA colleague @olivier_salgado takes us on an aerial tour of this under-appreciated treasure. #ServingForPeace 
https://t.co/12PcUGQWVF

The Caribbean experience makes the need for urgent #ClimateAction abundantly clear.

For many, the summer holidays are a time for fun & relaxation, but it's also an important time for parents & caregivers to be vigilant when it comes to safety. @WHO has tips on how to be safe in the summer: https://t.co/9pVtYrH8Kx  #SafeSchoolHoliday https://t.co/5vN6XFanAK

"Now we grow all that we need." 

With support from @FAO in South Sudan, Adut is managing a plot of land where 40 women now grow their own food -- just one way the UN is helping local communities fight malnutrition. https://t.co/fELntNGtOp  #ZeroHunger

“You are our important allies” —@antonioguterres praises Caribbean island nations for their innovative #ClimateAction at @CARICOMorg meeting.

In our interconnected world, no country can address today's challenges alone. Achieving the #GlobalGoals requires successful partnerships 🤝 between governments, the private sector and civil society. https://t.co/YcN2gxbQsr https://t.co/yCXNUctbTI

Clean energy transforms lives, economies & the world.
